data.title: Andrew Jackson’s Hermitage (Nashville)
data.meta_description: Andrew Jackson’s Hermitage is a museum in Nashville. View visitor information, information about the collection and read reviews.
data.text:
The Hermitage is a historical museum situated in Davidson County, Tennessee, United States. It is located approximately 10 miles east of downtown Nashville. This location makes it easily accessible for tourists visiting the city and looking for a historical experience.

Historical Significance of The Hermitage

The Hermitage spans a vast area of 1,000 acres and was owned by Andrew Jackson, the seventh president of the United States. He owned the property from 1804 until his death at the Hermitage in 1845. This historical connection adds a significant layer of interest for visitors.

The Site of The Hermitage

The Hermitage is built in a secluded meadow, a site chosen by Rachel Jackson, the wife of Andrew Jackson. This adds a personal touch to the history of the site, making it more engaging for visitors.
